name: Metasploit
description: Metasploit is a widely-used framework that provides a range of tools and exploits for penetration testing, including privilege escalation. It allows security professionals to identify vulnerabilities, exploit them, and gain higher privileges on target systems.

name: PowerSploit
description: PowerSploit is a collection of PowerShell scripts that focuses on post-exploitation activities, including privilege escalation. It provides various modules and techniques for escalating privileges in Windows environments.

name: OpenVAS
description: A framework of several services and tools for vulnerability scanning and management.

name: Acunetix
description: A web vulnerability scanner that can detect and manage thousands of web vulnerabilities.

name: Nessus
description: A vulnerability scanner that uses a client-server model to scan for vulnerabilities.

name: BeRoot
description: A toolkit for automated CTF Solving.

name: BeRoot
description: BeRoot is a Python-based privilege escalation tool that aids in finding potential privilege escalation vectors on Unix and Linux systems. It automates the process of searching for common misconfigurations or vulnerable services that could be leveraged for privilege escalation.

name: Windows Exploit Suggester
description: This tool is designed specifically for Windows environments. It analyzes a target system and suggests potential exploits and vulnerabilities that can be used to escalate privileges on the Windows operating system.

name: Linux Exploit Suggester
description: Linux Exploit Suggester scans a Linux system and suggests possible exploits and vulnerabilities that can be utilized for privilege escalation.

name: Raccoon
description: A high performance offensive security tool for reconnaissance and vulnerability scanning
